paper.title: THE CONNECTION OF STATIC CONSTRAINTS WITH DETERMINISM AND BOUNDEDNESS OF DYNAMIC SPECIFICATIONS

author.org: I.N.R.I.A., Domaine de Voluceau-Rocquencourt, 78153 Le Chesnay, FRANCE
CSE Department, University of California at San Diego, La Jolla, CA 92093 USA

paper.venue: Proceedings of the Third International Conference on Data and Knowledge Bases#R##N#Improving Usability and Responsiveness
paper.abstract: Abstract The interaction between static and dynamic specifications of the valid states of a database is studied. Two fundamental properties of dynamic specifications are introduced: boundedness and determinism. The connection between well-known classes of static constraints and bounded or determinisic specifications is investigated. It is shown that commonly used static constraints may require non-deterministic corresponding dynamic specifications. These results raise interesting questions about database design using dynamic specifications.
